response.skills: Java, Python, Algorithms, Linux, Matlab, Data Analysis, Machine Learning, C++, Programming, Computer Science, LaTeX, MySQL, Statistics, Simulations, JavaScript, R, Unified Modeling Language (UML)

profile_positions.description: Working with Solidity (for AION and Ethereum) and Hyperledger Sawtooth
profile_positions.title: Lead Blockchain Engineer

profile_positions.description:
Worked as customer facing Technical Leader for Southwest Airlines in projects aimed at the Crew Planning and the Aircraft Operations departments:

 1. Lead a full-stack team (~15 people) working on an operational software (processing around 10 million events daily). Technologies: Akka (and Akka-cluster), GemFire (in-memory data grid), Apache CXF, Camel, Spring JMS, Quartz, Knockout/Durandal, CometD, and other technologies for a Domain Driven Design application using CQRS and Event Sourcing patterns.

 2. Lead a full-stack team(~10 people) solving defects from a prototype application. Technologies: AngularJS, Spring MVC, ElasticSearch, Spring Batch.
profile_positions.title: Tech Lead @ Southwest Airlines

profile_positions.description:
Worked for Southwest Airlines in projects aimed at the Crew Planning department:

 1. Helped to migrate web services providers/consumers to Apache CXF in order to use a token-based security plugin.

 2. Helped to develop an AngularJS (with Webpack, Gulp, Bootstrap) application (tested with Karma + Jasmine and Protractor) and helped to support the Continuous Integration infrastructure (Jenkins).

 3. As one of the finalist of an internal intraperneurship contest (IFactor) traveled to Argentina to take innovation and entrepreneurship courses from Endeavor.
profile_positions.title: Java Developer @ Southwest Airlines

profile_positions.description:
Guided by professors Gerhard Klimeck and Michael Povolotskyi:

1. Development, deployment and maintenance of a continuous integration and testing system for NEMO5 using Jenkins, Python scripts, Java and MySQL.

2. Worked hand in hand with Intel engineers to develop C++ and MPI code to compete with Xeon Phis co-processors  in the Gordon Bell Prize competition  of 2014 (The submission was successfully sent on 2015).

3. Development of a profiling information visualization tool using PHP and Javascript.

4. Development of tools for compilation across multiple supercomputers using autotools.

5. Documented (using UML) and presented the architecture of the software for clients from TSMC and Intel.

6. Assisted scientist in the implementation of some semiconductor simulations algorithms in C/C++ for NEMO5.
profile_positions.title: Research assistant @ Gecko Group

profile_positions.description:
Guided by professor Eduardo Romero:

1. Lead, design, document, develop, ship and report a Hospital Information System using international standards (HL7 and DICOM) and enterprise Java technologies (EJB, JMS, JPA, JSF/PrimeFaces)

2. Lead the development team, write internal documentation wiki, prepare executive presentations for potential customers.
profile_positions.title: Software Engineer @ CIM@LAB

profile_positions.description:
Guided by professor Fabio Gonzalez:

1. Competed in the international contest ImageCLEF (Annotation subtask) of 2013 and 2014. In 2014 the third place was achieved by the team.

2. Worked on matrix factorization techniques by writing stochastic optimization software for automatic image annotation.
profile_positions.title: Research assistant @ MindLab

company.name: Kinesso
company.description: Kinesso is the connected intelligence company that builds applications and software solutions, working with agencies and partners to deliver consistent and relevant customer experiences for people across all channels. Kinesso’s technology solutions and services span audience, planning, and activation, delivering insights that drive growth for leading global brands. Kinesso is part of The Interpublic Group of Companies, Inc. (IPG). For more information, visit kinesso.com.
